column4: hey guys i have a weird issue i have a custom built box dual booting xp and ubuntu
i mount my ntfs partition within linux
when i went to reboot and boot into windows i got a grub interface
did linux overwrite my xp mbr? is the question and if it did..how so
compiz@ mhall153
you should be able to select windows xp from the grub menu
basicaly,  the ubuntu installer rewrites the mbr to point to the grub menu
are you getting an error msg ?
hold on
pastebin your  /boot/grub/menu.lst  file so I can have a look
ahhh
dl the supergrub cd and us it to fix your windows mbr
http://supergrub.forjamari.linex.org/
it is very reliable but the menu structure is a bit confusing in my opinion
personnaly , I have boot xp and ubunt on a seperete hdd,  I made sure that the ubuntu hdd was set to boot from the bios when i installed ubuntu,  that wayeach mbr is sepreate
somehow he got grub stage one installed on both hdd
very odd
in anycase you'll be able to fix this using the supergrub cd
I don'T think that would be related
that's all I can tell you since you can'T show me your menu.lst file or the fstab atm
try doing a search on your hardware in the forum,  there aer probabaly diagnostic tools listed in there www.ubuntuforums.org
this is a channel for the support of the current release of ubuntu ,  you might not get ppl who know about cvs of third party apps,  try finding an enlightenemetn chanel
